title: Shark Tank's Anupam Mittal calls out L&T chairman with hilarious question: 'If husband, wife don’t look at each other…' - Hindustan Times
summary:
Anupam Mittal Responds Hilariously to L&T Chairman's Controversial Remarks

Date: Jan 13, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Anupam Mittal from Shark Tank India humorously responded to L&T Chairman SN Subrahmanyan's remarks about employee productivity versus home life. His witty reply raised awareness on work-life balance issues.

  • L&T Chairman SN Subrahmanyan suggested he would prefer if employees worked on Sundays.
  • He posed a controversial question regarding how long employees could stare at their wives at home.
  • Anupam Mittal joked that if husbands and wives don't look at each other, India won't remain the most populous country.
  • Deepika Padukone and other public figures criticized Subrahmanyan's remarks, emphasizing the importance of mental health.
  • L&T attempted to clarify the chairman's comments, which some experts deemed insufficient.
“But sir, if husband and wife don’t look at each other, how will we remain the most populous country in the world?” - Anupam Mittal

The exchange highlights the ongoing discourse regarding workplace culture and the significance of mental health in corporate environments.
newTitle: Anupam Mittal Responds Hilariously to L&T Chairman's Controversial Remarks

title: Rupee to weaken past 86/USD on hawkish Fed outlook - The Economic Times
summary:
Rupee Dips Past 86/USD for the First Time on Hawkish Fed Outlook

Publication Date: [Date not specified] Source: [Source not specified]

The Indian rupee has weakened past the 86 to the U.S. dollar for the first time, prompted by a stronger than expected U.S. jobs report which has implications for the Federal Reserve's interest rate strategy.

  • The rupee opened at a record low of 86.2050, falling from 85.9650 the previous Friday.
  • 256,000 jobs were added in the U.S. last month, significantly above expectations of 160,000.
  • The unemployment rate in the U.S. unexpectedly declined to 4.1%.
  • Speculators are likely to continue holding bearish positions on the rupee due to the recent job numbers.
  • The Federal Reserve may focus more on inflation as concerns about job market risks diminish.
  • Market expectations suggest only one rate cut by the Fed for the year ahead.
  • The dollar index reached a two-year high of 109.72, reflecting the strength of the U.S. dollar.
  • 10-year U.S. bond yields have risen to 4.76%.
“Having said that, I think we are now near levels where a number of negatives (for the rupee) are in the price. Plus, we are long overdue a decent correction.” – A currency trader

This new low for the rupee reflects broader economic trends and investor sentiment towards U.S. monetary policy.
newTitle: Rupee Hits Historic Low of 86/USD Amid Hawkish Fed Outlook

title: CATS Warrior Drone: Why IAF Is Unlikely To Place Orders For HAL’s “Stealth UAV” Despite All The Hoopla? - EurAsian Times
summary:
CATS Warrior Drone: Why IAF Is Unlikely To Place Orders For HAL’s “Stealth UAV” Despite All The Hoopla?

Publication Date: January 11, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Aeronautics Limited (HAL)

HAL's CATS Warrior drone has made headlines after its successful Engine Ground Run. However, experts have raised concerns about its design and capabilities, casting doubt on its readiness for operational use.

  • HAL announced the successful Engine Ground Run of the CATS Warrior drone, an important step for its Combat Air Teaming System.
  • The CATS concept involves coordinating multiple autonomous UAVs, with the Warrior designed for combat operations.
  • Key specifications include a maximum take-off weight of 1,300 kg, a flight speed of approximately 850 km/h, and a range of 800 km.
  • The drone's stealth characteristics are said to rely heavily on its radar cross-section reduction features.
  • Concerns have been raised regarding the drone's actual weight and performance capabilities compared to HAL's claims.
  • Experts suggest that HAL must expedite the development of the CATS program to meet its promises.
“At the current state of its development, under no circumstances should the IAF be coerced into committing and placing orders for the CATS.” – Vijainder K Thakur

In conclusion, while HAL has made progress with the CATS Warrior, there are significant doubts about its operational readiness that must be addressed before the IAF considers placing orders.
newTitle: CATS Warrior Drone: An Analysis of HAL's Stealth UAV Orders

This trend signals potential investment opportunities as these stocks maintain their positions above the critical moving average.

title: Beware: 90-hour workweek is nothing; companies are now hiring detectives to check if you're unwell during sick leaves | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
Beware: 90-hour workweek is nothing; companies are now hiring detectives to check if you’re unwell during sick leaves

Date: October 2023 Source: Agence France-Presse

Companies in Germany are increasingly hiring detectives to investigate employees taking sick leave, amidst a backdrop of high absenteeism and a struggling economy. This troubling trend is highlighted by a rise in sick leave checks driven by concerns over productivity.

  • Significant scrutiny on sick leave practices in Germany.
  • Companies report a surge in requests for detective services to verify employee health.
  • A concerning trend of high sick leave rates impacting the economy, with 6.8% of working hours missed due to illness in 2023.
  • Economic contraction of 0.3 percent attributed to absenteeism.
“If someone has 30, 40 or sometimes up to 100 sick days in a year, then at some point they become economically unattractive for the employer.” - Marcus Lentz

The growing number of sick days has prompted fierce debates about work culture and employee wellness practices, especially against the backdrop of calls for longer work hours in other countries.
newTitle: Companies in Germany Hire Detectives to Verify Sick Leaves Amid Growing Scrutiny

"The nonfarm payrolls report showed that U.S. employers added 2.56 lac jobs in December, well above the estimates of 1.55 lac."

title: Bumper Apple crop! India’s iPhone exports pass Rs 1 lk cr - The Economic Times
summary:
Bumper Apple Crop: India’s iPhone Exports Surpass ₹1 Lakh Crore

Publication Date: Not Specified, Source: Economic Times

India has achieved a milestone in iPhone exports, surpassing the ₹1 lakh crore mark in 2024, driven by an increase in local value addition and domestic production.

  • iPhone exports from India totaled $12.8 billion (₹1.08 lakh crore), marking a 42% year-on-year increase.
  • Domestic production rose nearly 46% in 2023, reaching $17.5 billion (₹1.48 lakh crore).
  • Apple has improved local value addition to 15-20% depending on the model.
  • Foxconn, Tata Electronics, and Pegatron are key contract manufacturers contributing to iPhone exports.
  • The production-linked incentive (PLI) scheme has significantly boosted exports and job creation.
“Apple’s achievement remains unparalleled in a year for any single product export from India,” a government official stated.

Apple's focus on local supply chains and production is expected to continue driving growth in the coming years.
newTitle: Bumper Apple Crop: India’s iPhone Exports Surpass ₹1 Lakh Crore

title: Air India ‘bullish’ on long-haul travel - The Hindu
summary:
Air India ‘bullish’ on long-haul travel

Date: January 12, 2025 Source: The Hindu

Air India Group is experiencing rapid growth in long-haul travel as it completes three years of privatization. The airline is expanding its international reach significantly.

  • The airline’s market share on international routes has increased from 16% to 21% since the Tata Group acquisition.
  • Air India has added nine new long-haul routes, raising the total to 37 served routes.
  • Daily flight frequencies on these routes have more than doubled from 30 to 69.
  • The airline aims to increase its share of international passengers from 21% to 50%.
  • Air India generated nearly 50% of its total revenue from lucrative long-haul routes.
  • The airline plans to enhance connectivity and attract transit passengers by reducing connection times.
“Indian airlines enjoy only 21% share of total international passengers, while there is room to grow up to 50%.”

With strategic expansions and fleet upgrades, Air India is positioning itself for major growth in the competitive long-haul travel market.
newTitle: Air India Optimistic About Long-Haul Travel Growth

title: Air India to offer first class seats in A350-1000 planes to compete with best airlines | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
Air India to Offer First Class Seats in A350-1000 Plans

Publication Date: New Delhi

Air India is set to include first class seats in its A350-1000 aircraft as part of its strategy to enhance its presence in the competitive airline market.

  • Air India's Chief Commercial Officer emphasized the importance of first class as a niche market.
  • The airline's fleet currently consists of 202 planes, with various routes identified for first class service.
  • Air India anticipates inducting A350-1000s in the coming years, with an initial focus on major markets like London and New York.
  • Efforts to retrofit existing aircraft, including Boeing 787s and legacy Airbus 320 neos, are underway.
  • The retrofit of Boeing 777 aircraft commences next year to improve service reliability.
"To compete with the best airlines you need to have first class, it is an aspirational product..." - Nipun Aggarwal, Chief Commercial Officer

The introduction of first class seating aims to enhance Air India's competitiveness and attract premium passengers, leveraging opportunities in strategic markets.
newTitle: Air India to Introduce First Class Seats in A350-1000 to Compete Globally

title: Indian crypto exchange Mudrex explains withdrawal suspension - Cointelegraph
summary:
Mudrex Temporarily Halts Crypto Withdrawals Amid Community Backlash

Date: January 11, 2023 | Source: Cointelegraph

Indian cryptocurrency exchange Mudrex has halted crypto withdrawals until January 28, 2023, triggering backlash from users concerned about fund security. The suspension aims to upgrade the platform's compliance framework.

  • Mudrex paused withdrawals on January 11, 2023.
  • Co-founder Edul Patel emphasized the need for proper infrastructure to prevent misuse.
  • Community members expressed skepticism and urgency in warning others to withdraw funds.
  • Mudrex reported significant user growth and trading volume amidst increasing regulatory scrutiny in India.
  • CoinDCX has introduced crypto withdrawals, allowing limited users to opt in.
“You need to do that with something as critical as crypto. If the infrastructure is not correct, it is very easy for it to be misused...” – Edul Patel, Co-founder of Mudrex

The temporary suspension has raised concerns about trust and security among Mudrex users, reflecting the larger challenges faced by cryptocurrency exchanges in India.
newTitle: Mudrex Temporarily Halts Crypto Withdrawals Amid Community Backlash
